title: Dog animation engine with sprite system
description: SVG-based animation engine for dog sprites: idle, alert, barking, happy, sad, sleeping, eating states with smooth transitions
acceptance_criteria:
GIVEN the app displays a virtual dog
WHEN the dog's state changes
THEN it should:
- Animate smoothly between states (idle, alert, barking, happy, sad, sleeping, eating)
- Show appropriate animation for current mood
- Respond to user interactions (tap, swipe)
- Display breed-specific characteristics
- Run at 30+ FPS without janking

AUTOMATED TESTS REQUIRED:
✓ Unit Tests:
  - Animation state machine transitions correctly
  - Animation timing calculations correct
  - Breed-specific animations loaded
  - Animation loop/one-shot logic works

✓ Widget Tests:
  - Dog widget displays SVG correctly
  - Animation state updates UI
  - Touch interactions trigger responses
  - Performance: renders in <16ms per frame

✓ Integration Tests:
  - Mood changes trigger correct animations
  - Alarm state changes trigger correct animations
  - Multiple rapid state changes don't break animations

MANUAL TESTS:
- Visually verify each animation for each breed
- Test on low-end devices (smooth 30 FPS)
- Verify animations feel lively and expressive
- Check transitions are smooth, not jarring

DONE WHEN:
- All automated tests pass
- Code coverage ≥75% for animation engine
- All 7 breeds have all 8 animation states
- Animations run smoothly on mid-range phones
- User testing confirms animations are "cute"

acceptance_criteria:

- Prevent accidental deactivation

AUTOMATED TESTS REQUIRED:
✓ Unit Tests:
  - Countdown timer counts down correctly
  - Timer can be cancelled
  - Alarm state transitions correctly (inactive→countdown→active→triggered→deactivated)
  - Unlock code validation works
  - Unlock code hashing/security

✓ Widget Tests:
  - Countdown displays correctly
  - Activation button disabled during countdown
  - Unlock screen appears when active
  - Visual state indicators show correct state

✓ Integration Tests:
  - Full activation → detection → trigger → deactivation flow
  - Incorrect unlock code blocks deactivation

  - State persists across app restart

MANUAL TESTS:

- Try canceling at various points

- Test unlock code entry UX
- Verify visual clarity of each state

DONE WHEN:
- All automated tests pass

- Unlock code is securely stored (hashed)
- UX is intuitive (user testing)
- No accidental activations/deactivations
